title: Twitch reverses overlaid stream sponsor ban after mass creator backlash [Updated]
content:
[Update (9:53 p.m. EDT): In a tweeted statement Wednesday evening, Twitch said that yesterday's Brand Content Guideline update was "bad for you and bad for Twitch." As such, the guidelines discussed in the story below are being removed immediately, the company says.

"Sponsorships are critical to streamers’ growth and ability to earn income," Twitch writes. "We will not prevent your ability to enter into direct relationships with sponsors – you will continue to own and control your sponsorship business... We appreciate your feedback and help in making this change."

A newly updated Branded Content Guidelines page removes all previous mentions of prohibitions or restrictions for "burned in" ads or logos placed on top of streams by the streamers themselves. The only remaining significant restrictions involve certain types of products and services, including tobacco, cannabis, firearms, and "certain financial products and services" like MLMs.]
